statements: CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50), email VARCHAR(50), date_joined TIMESTAMP)
CREATE TABLE users (user_id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, email VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL)
CREATE TABLE posts (post_id INT PRIMARY KEY, user_id INT NOT NULL, post_content TEXT NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL, FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id))
CREATE TABLE example_table_1 (id INT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, description TEXT, created_at TIMESTAMP);
CREATE TABLE example_table_2 (id INT PRIMARY KEY, user_id INT, post_content TEXT NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP, FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id));

CREATE TABLE example_table_3 (id INT PRIMARY KEY, post_id INT, user_id INT, comment_text TEXT NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP, FOREIGN KEY (post_id) REFERENCES posts(post_id), FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id));
CREATE TABLE example_table_1 (id INT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE, created_at DATE);
CREATE TABLE example_table_2 (id INT PRIMARY KEY, user_id INT REFERENCES users(user_id), post_content TEXT, post_date DATE);
CREATE TABLE example_table_3 (id INT PRIMARY KEY, post_id INT REFERENCES posts(post_id), user_id INT REFERENCES users(user_id), comment_text TEXT, comment_date DATE);
CREATE TABLE ExampleTable1 (example_id INT PRIMARY KEY, example_column1 VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, example_column2 VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE, example_column3 TEXT, created_at TIMESTAMP)

CREATE TABLE ExampleTable2 (example_id INT PRIMARY KEY, example_column1 INT, example_column2 TEXT, created_at TIMESTAMP, FOREIGN KEY (example_column1) REFERENCES ExampleTable1(example_id) ON DELETE CASCADE)

CREATE TABLE ExampleTable3 (example_id INT PRIMARY KEY, example_column1 INT, example_column2 INT, example_column3 TEXT, created_at TIMESTAMP, FOREIGN KEY (example_column1) REFERENCES ExampleTable2(example_id) ON DELETE CASCADE, FOREIGN KEY (example_column2) REFERENCES ExampleTable1(example_id) ON DELETE CASCADE)
